title: How to Make Penguins Out of Food

steps.headline: Peel the carrot with a vegetable peeler or a suitable knife.
Top and tail the carrot.
steps.description: Cut the carrot into rounds, make "Carrot Pennies" A.K.A. circular carrot pieces.

steps.headline: Using a parking knife cut a V shape into one of the carrot slices.
steps.description: Only cut a small 'V', this will be your penguin's beak. The remainder of the slice will be the feet.

steps.headline: Cut a slit into the side of one of the extra large olives with a knife.
Put the cream cheese into the baggy.
Close up the bag and work the cream cheese into a corner of the bag.
Cut a small hole in the corner of the bag.
steps.description: Pick your olive back up. Squeeze the cream cheese into his "Chest Cavity" and fill it up.

steps.headline: Take one of the small olives and pick up that carrot slice shaped like a V.
Stick a toothpicks through the head, and following through to the body.
Take that "Carrot Penny" and stick it through the very bottom of the toothpick, so it will be the feet.

text: Peel the carrot with a vegetable peeler or a suitable knife.  Top and tail the carrot. Cut the carrot into rounds, make "Carrot Pennies" A.K.A. circular carrot pieces. Using a parking knife cut a V shape into one of the carrot slices. Only cut a small 'V', this will be your penguin's beak. The remainder of the slice will be the feet. Cut a slit into the side of one of the extra large olives with a knife.  Put the cream cheese into the baggy.  Close up the bag and work the cream cheese into a corner of the bag.  Cut a small hole in the corner of the bag. Pick your olive back up. Squeeze the cream cheese into his "Chest Cavity" and fill it up. Take one of the small olives and pick up that carrot slice shaped like a V.  Stick a toothpicks through the head, and following through to the body.  Take that "Carrot Penny" and stick it through the very bottom of the toothpick, so it will be the feet.  Finished.
